page.title: 09Transport on Hunshelf I
page.content: The majority of the roads are fairly quiet C-class roads,but there are some A-roads,including the A616 along the valley bottom.The roads mainly run south to Stocksbridge and north to Penistone and Barnsley.As well as cars and bicycles,the roads are used by tractors from the local farms and lorries supplying the steelworks:most of the roads do not allow vehicles over 3 tonnes. There are few bus routes.They run to Barnsley and arrive at the stops twice a day. A old railway line runs through the area, although there are no stations.The trains ran to Sheffield and Manchester. Stocksbridge Works have a private railway,whose sidings lie near Underbank Reservoir.
